FuncDef:
The tftp server acl command configures the ACL to control the access of clients to the FTP server.
The undo tftp server acl command cancels the configuration of the ACL. The tftp server acl command configures the ACL to control the access of clients to the FTP server. The undo tftp server acl command cancels the configuration of the ACL. By default, no ACL is configured for the TFTP client.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 ACL number.
The number of a basic ACL is an integer that ranges from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the ACL4 name.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The value must start with a letter (a to z or A to Z) and cannot contain only digits.

ExtraInfo: When a device functions as a TFTP client, you can configure an ACL on the device to control the TFTP servers that the device can log in to through TFTP.
